Message.Title: 16 minutes and the MD boeing lithium battery caused fatal accidents , Airbus going with safe nicad for now A350
Message.Msg: The Honeywell beacon on the Dreamliner is located in a section of the airplane, above the ceiling panels near the tail, where fires have proven deadly, according to U.S. and U.K. regulators. A fire that started in the ceiling of a Swissair Boeing MD-11 on Sept. 2, 1998, caused the pilots to lose control. All 229 people aboard died when the plane plunged into the ocean near Halifax, Nova Scotia. It took only 16 minutes from the time the crew detected the fire until the plane became uncontrollable, according to an FAA advisory. There have been at least seven fatal accidents worldwide after fires started in hidden areas, according to the advisory. If the lithium battery-fed fire that scorched a parked and empty Boeing Co. (BA) Dreamliner jet in London had occurred over the ocean, hours from an airport, the result could have been catastrophic. The July 12 blaze on the Ethiopian Airlines Enterprise 787 was in a difficult-to-reach space and couldn’t be put out by the plane’s fire extinguishers, according to U.K. regulators. Only one-third of airliners with such hidden fires can be expected to land safely, an earlier U.K. study concluded! Since 2009, there have been 26 instances of lithium-based batteries overheating or catching fire aboard U.S. carriers, according to a log kept by the FAA. The FAA issued a safety alert to airlines in 2010 after a United Parcel Service Inc. Boeing 747 carrying a shipment of lithium batteries caught fire and crashed in Dubai. The United Arab Emirates General Civil Aviation Authority is scheduled to issue a report on that accident on July 24. Lithium-manganese-dioxide batteries, like those that power the Honeywell beacons, can be so volatile and difficult to extinguish that the FAA banned their shipment as cargo on passenger planes in 2004.

Topic.Title: Geroge Zimmerman got a Fair Trial

Message.Msg: All good points, Hooz; maybe the worst you can say about Trayvon's reaction is he should have had a little anger management coaching. (Though I recognize that our lead Bible-thumper is convinced he is already in he !!, and Bob himself will never in all eternity be asked, "Did you know him?" (Apologies if I sound judgmental.) :-) I absolutely take you point about the Supreme Court and Roe v. Wade. The extreme right always seems to apply a double standard about law -- what's ours is ours, as JFK might say, and what's yours in negotiable. And the Republican party? No one can deny they have lost their way in their terror that middle-aged and elderly white males have become a tiny minority. Neo-Nazis fear that too, and react only slightly differently.

Message.Msg: remember jjovaz is a hater of Boeing union workers and blamed Boeing workers for sabotage and is a little off his rocker to say the least. the conclusion of the investigation was Both Boeing and the Union gave 100% support to the union workers and the wires in question were found and repaired by union workers so this jjovaz is nothing more than a trouble maker. "There is no way we could ever deliver a plane with wire damage because of the redundancy testing that is done," Angers said. "That redundancy testing is performed on all wiring through the production process."

Topic.Title: 16 minutes and the MD boeing lithium battery caused fatal accidents , Airbus going with safe nicad for now A350

Message.Msg: FLT 111 Swissair was considerable more gruesome than most of the accounts say. The flight deck overhead fire had penetrated the Oxygen system. Fire was like a blow torch fwd into the cockpit and aft into the cabin. the rows of seat behind the flight deck had the seat material melting (starts melting around 575 degrees) It should give an idea of conditions, the worst nightmare. An example of the seriousness of fires on airplanes. The most serious condition and it demands the absolute most attention.

Topic.Title: Geroge Zimmerman got a Fair Trial

Message.Msg: There's following, and there's stalking. One is legal and one isn't. If Martin had been a woman, Zimmerman's actions would probably have been perceived as stalking. Not that men don't get stalked, but the public takes it more seriously when it happens to a woman. And, if a woman had thumped Zimmerman in the head with a brick, or popped him with a firearm from her handbag, Zimmerman wouldn't have been acquitted even if the woman ended up dead. I still say the jury came to the correct conclusion, but it doesn't mean Zimmerman wasn't over the line.

Message.Title: Boeing earnings july 24th Q 2 ?
Message.Msg: Boeing (NYSE: BA ) is expected to report Q2 earnings on July 24. Here's what Wall Street wants to see: The 10-second takeaway Comparing the upcoming quarter to the prior-year quarter, average analyst estimates predict Boeing's revenues will grow 3.9% and EPS will expand 22.8%. The average estimate for revenue is $20.78 billion. On the bottom line, the average EPS estimate is $1.56. Revenue details Last quarter, Boeing reported revenue of $18.89 billion. GAAP reported sales were 2.5% lower than the prior-year quarter's $19.38 billion.Recent performance For the preceding quarter, gross margin was 16.6%, 50 basis points worse than the prior-year quarter. Operating margin was 7.7%, 10 basis points worse than the prior-year quarter. Net margin was 5.9%, 110 basis points better than the prior-year quarter. Revenue details Last quarter, Boeing reported revenue of $18.89 billion. GAAP reported sales were 2.5% lower than the prior-year quarter's $19.38 billion

Message.Title: Trayvon H phobic
Message.Msg: From Rush comments on Piers Morgan Jeantel interview: She told Trayvon to run, 'cause the guy might be a rapist. Trayvon was describing him to her. She said, "Well, you better run, Trayvon," and then she pointed out that Trayvon wasn't "that way," meaning he's not gay. And then she reminded everybody that Trayvon's little brother was at the house where he was staying and didn't want that predator following them home with the little baby there. So it wasn't racism, It was homophobia. Trayvon Martin was homophobic, as admitted to by Rachel Jeantel. So Trayvon gave him an a kicking because he thought Zimmerman was a gay perv. This explains a lot in a weird Charles Bronson Shakespearean way.

Topic.Title: Geroge Zimmerman got a Fair Trial

Message.Msg: "Though I recognize that our lead Bible-thumper is convinced he is already in he !!" No. That is the opposite of what I said. I was giving him the benefit of the doubt. Re-read the post. I said, "if he were a Christian ..." I never said he was not. I do not know and you do not know. The subject trigger about his faith was from Jeantel's discussion of her praying for him and her encouraging him to pray. My point was that sometimes the Lord takes Christians "home" (that is heaven) when their behavior brings shame to the name of the Lord. That is the meaning and warning of 1 Corinthans 5:5. And Trayvon's behavior was shameful, as he testified about himself through his salacious and graphic Tweets as well as cell phone text messages regarding his school behavior, his drug use, his being kicked out of his mom's house, his seeking to obtain an illegal weapon, his insensitivity to someone being beat up, etc. He indicted himself. It is not a gigantic leap of logic to presume, based upon his other salacious and recurring violent behavior that he started the altercation with Zimmerman. And apparently, that is also what the jury thought. I see the tragedy; I just don't see his being a Poster Child for anything other than bad behavior.

Message.Title: BA Partner Company Ready to Double in Value
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) next month is set to report their fiscal 2013 annual results and if their 4Q is a repeat of the 3Q, CCUR's GAAP EPS for the year will be $0.33 vs. a loss of ($0.34) in fiscal 2012, along with a non-GAAP EPS profit of $0.52. Major consolidation is taking place in the pay-TV industry and CCUR is one of the largest technology vendors serving the industry. Time Warner Cable (TWC) - America's #2 cable TV operator - relies on CCUR's technology for video on demand (VOD), start-over, look-back, CDN video solutions, multi-screen video delivery, and more! CCUR just signed a huge CDN/multi-screen deal with Virgin Media, the largest cable TV operator in the UK, and revenues from Virgin will begin to show up for the first time in CCUR's earnings for the 4Q in next month's 10-K! CCUR's top two publicly traded competitors are SEAC and HLIT. Both hit new 52-week highs last week. SEAC is now trading with an enterprise value/revenue ratio of 1.85 and HLIT has an enterprise value/revenue ratio of 1.09. Their average enterprise value/revenue ratio of 1.47 would value CCUR today at $13.17 per share. CCUR has had resistance between $8 and $8.45, but as soon as CCUR breaks through this it should explode to a minimum of $13. CCUR currently pays an industry leading dividend yield of 6.2%! CCUR's potential non-GAAP EPS for the year of $0.52 will exceed SEAC's current trailing non-GAAP EPS of $0.44 as well as HLIT's current trailing non-GAAP EPS of $0.21! CCUR deserves to be trading well above SEAC's current share price of $12.32 and for more than double HLIT's current share price of $6.99. CCUR has almost no downside here at $7.78! CCUR also has a "real time" computer processor technology division and BA is one of their major clients!
